verses.verse: Therefore when the Lord knew that the Pharisees heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
(although Jesus himself didn't baptize, but his disciples [did])
he left Judea and went back to Galilee.
But it was necessary for him to go through Samaria.
So he came to a Samaritan city, called Sychar, near the piece of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
Jacob's well was there. Therefore Jesus, tired out from the journey, sat by the well. It was around the sixth hour [noon].
A Samaritan woman came to draw water, and Jesus says to her, "Give me a drink of water."
(His disciples had gone to the city to buy food.)
The Samaritan woman says to him, "How is it that you, a Jew, asks for a drink from me, a Samaritan woman, because the Jews have nothing to do with the Samaritans?"
Jesus answered and said to her, "If you knew God's gift and who it is who asks you, «Give me a drink,» you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water."
The woman says to him, "Sir, you have nothing to draw water with, and the well is deep. So where then are you going to get this living water?
"Are you greater than our forefather Jacob who gave us the well and drank from it along with his children and cattle?"
Jesus answered and says to her, "Everyone who drinks this water will thirst again.
Whoever drinks the water that I will give him will never thirst, furthermore the water I will give him will become in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life."
The woman says to him, "Sir, give me this water, in order that I may never thirst, neither come here to draw water."
Jesus says to her, "Go, call your husband, and come here."
The woman answered and says, "I have no husband."
Jesus says to her, "You answered honestly that you have no husband, for you have had five husbands, and the present one you have is not your husband, you have told the truth in this."
The woman says to him, "Sir, I perceive that you are a prophet.
"Our forefathers worshipped on this mountain, yet you say that in Jerusalem is the place where people should worship."
Jesus says to her, "Woman, believe me, the hour is coming, when not even in this mountain or in Jerusalem will people worship the Father.
"You don't know what you are worshiping. We know what we worship, for salvation is from the Jews.
"But the time is coming, and now is, when true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father is looking for such as this to worship him.
"God is spirit, and for those who worship him, it is necessary to worship in spirit and truth."
The woman says to him, "I know that Messiah is coming, who is called Christ. When he comes, he will make all things known to us."
Jesus says to her, "I am he, the one speaking to you."
And at this [moment] his disciples came and were shocked that he was talking with the woman, yet no one said, "What are you seeking" or, "Why are you talking with her?"
Then the woman left her water jar and went off to the city and said to the men,
"Come, see a man who told me everything that I ever did. Is not this the Christ?"
Then they went out of the city and came to him.
In the meantime his disciples kept urgently asking him, "Rabbi, eat."
But he said to them, "I have food to eat that you don't know about."
Then the disciples said to one another, "Has someone brought him something to eat?"
Jesus said to them, "My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to complete his work.
"Don't you say that there are still four months and then comes the harvest? Look, I say to you, «Lift up you eyes and look at the fields, for they are white even now ready to harvest.»
"And he who reaps receives pay and gathers the crop for eternal life, in order that both the sower and the harvester may rejoice together.
"For this saying is the truth, «One sows and another harvests.»
"I sent you to harvest what you have put in no hard work. Others have worked, and you have entered into their labors."
Many of the Samaritans of that city believed in him through the report of the woman who said, "He told me everything I ever did."
So when the Samaritans came to him, they begged him to stay with them, and he stayed there two days.
And many more believed through his own word.
They told the woman, "We now believe, not only because of what you said, but because we have heard for ourselves and know that this is the Christ, the Savior of the world."
Now after two days, he left there and went into Galilee.
For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.
Then when he arrived in Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, having seen everything that he did at Jerusalem at the festival, for they had also gone to the festival.
Then Jesus again went back to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. A certain nobleman was there whose son was sick at Capernaum.
When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and was imploring him so that he would come and heal his son, because he was at the point of death.
Then Jesus said to him, "Unless you [Galileans] see miracles and wonders, you absolutely will not believe."
The nobleman says to him, "Sir, Come down before my child dies."
Jesus says to him, "Go, your son lives." The man believed the word, which Jesus spoke to him and went.
And as he was going down, his servants met him and told him, saying, "Your sons lives."
He then asked them the hour in which he had gotten well. They said to him, "Yesterday the fever left him at the seventh hour [1 PM]."
Then the father knew that it was at that very hour when Jesus said to him, "Your son lives." So he believed along with his whole family.
Furthermore this second sign Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
